availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Stevens (Caldwell County, Kentucky, sheriff and farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, sheriff and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary F. Stevens. Father of Mary A. Stevens, Susan A. Stevens, Joel C. Stevens, Sarah G. Stevens, Jesse T. Stevens. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Joseph Tennill as a laborer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Sheriff in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed Hester Ann Prince as a domestic servant in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Sheriff in Caldwell County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 307A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 824.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton Division, p. 63.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton Division, p. 16.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862, in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), p. 63.
